lines.text:
[Eleanor has just been shown her room after she arrives]
I can't keep the rooms the way I'd like, but there's no one else they could get that would help me.
How very nice.

I set dinner on the dining room sideboard at 6. I clear up in the morning. I have breakfast for you at 9. I don't wait on people. I don't stay after I set out the dinner, not after it begins to get dark. I leave before the dark.
Your husband?
We live over in town, miles away.
Yes.
So there won't be anyone around if you need help.
I understand.
We couldn't hear you. In the night.
Do you have any idea when Dr. Markway...

[cuts her off]
No one could. No one lives any nearer than town. No one will come any nearer than that.
I know.
In the night. In the dark.
[Mrs. Dudley grins and leaves]
[first lines]

[voice-over]
An evil old house, the kind some people call haunted, is like an undiscovered country waiting to be explored. Hill House had stood for 90 years and might stand for 90 more. Silence lay steadily against the wood and stone of Hill House, and whatever walked there... walked alone.
Haven't you noticed how nothing in this house seems to move until you look away and then you just... catch something out of the corner of your eye?
Only one way to argue with a woman Doc... Don't.
Doc, I'll let you have the house cheap!

When people believed the earth was flat, the idea of a round world scared them silly. Then they found out how the round world works. It's the same with the world of the supernatural. Until we know how it works, we'll continue to carry around this unnecessary burden of fear.
You wait here, Grace. I'll go in and get your things, and then call the police.
No, no, no! No one must go back into that house again. Whatever's there might...
I'll be all right. The house has what it wants... for a while.
[last lines]

[voice-over]
Hill House has stood for 90 years and might stand for 90 more. Within, walls continue upright, bricks meet, floors are firm, and doors are sensibly shut. Silence lies steadily against the wood and stone of Hill House. And we who walk here... walk alone.
I got dizzy.
Dizzy like a fox, hmm?
Did something happen?

[she and Theodora start laughing hysterically]
No, nothing in particular, just someone banging on the door with a cannon ball!
It was an evil house from the beginning - a house that was born bad.
The dead are not quiet in Hill House.
Now. Which door?

[pointing to her right]
That one.
Wrong. I've studied the map, it's this one.
[goes to his right and walks straight into the broom cupboard]
It has taken 60 million years to develop the carnivorous biped you see before you, Luke Sanderson.
Let's see what kind of martinis it makes.
They should be pretty good. I majored in them at college.
What would you call this place? Fun-o-rama?
Human nature could certainly stand some improvement.
What scares you, Theodora?
Knowing what I really want.

[referring to Hill House]
It ought to be burned down... and the ground sowed with salt.
A closed mind is the worst defense against the supernatural... If it happens to you, your liable to have that shut door in your mind ripped right off it's hinges!
You'll be sorry I ever opened the gate.
You see? You haven't a ghost of a chance.
Look, I know the supernatural is something that isn't supposed to happen, but it does happen.
I haven't seen a damn thing! I just don't like the way it looks.
I'm still so terrified from last night.
You shouldn't be. It's silly to be frightened...
Silly? You haven't been through it! This horrible unknown thing!

'Unknown.' That's the key word. 'Unknown.' When we become involved in a supernatural event, we're scared out of our wits just because it's unknown. The night cry of a child. A face on the wall. Knockings, bangings. What's there to be afraid of? You weren't threatened. It was harmless, like a joke that doesn't come out.
But the child...
There was no child, remember? Just a voice.
A voice.

Look, Eleanor, put it this way. When people believed the Earth was flat, the idea of a round world scared them silly. Then they found out how the round world works. It's the same with the world of the supernatural. Until we know how it works, we'll continue to carry around this unnecessary burden of fear.
Supposing it is in my imagination. The knocking, the voices. Everything! Every cursed bit of the haunting. Suppose the haunting is all in my mind.

Well, you can't say that, because there are three other people here. We all resist the idea that what ran through the garden that first night was a ghost. What banged on the door was a ghost. What held your hand was a ghost. But there is certainly something going on in Hill House. We're getting closer, very close to finding out what it is.
Is this another one of your crazy hallucinations?
I'm not crazy!
Crazy as a loon! You really expect me to believe that you're sane and the rest of the world is mad?
Well, why not? The world is full of inconsistencies. Unnatural things. Nature's mistakes they call you for instance!
God! God! Whose hand was I holding?
That's very good, Eleanor. You catch on quickly.

[gets jealous and stands up]
I'm hungry. Let's go.

[when the group compares themselves to four statues]
Which one am I?
You're the dog.
Poor Nell. You look like Death.
[after either nearly falling off a high balcony - or being pushed off - she is saved by John Markway]
Oh! This house! You have to watch it every minute!
Here you are. Okay, Isolde. Tristan wants you inside.
Leave me alone.
Stop trying to be the center of attention, Nell. Come inside.

[swipes Theodora's hand off her shoulder]
Don't touch me, Theo! You revolt me!
Whoa, can't you take a joke? I didn't know you were serious about Markway.
Of course you did.
I'm not jealous. I'm actually flattered that you have feelings for him. But he shouldn't be allowed to get away with it.
Get away with what?
You're making a fool of yourself over him.
Suppose I'm not, though? You'd mind terribly if you turned out to be wrong for once, wouldn't you?
You poor stupid innocent.
I'd rather be innocent then like you!

[walks towards the door]
Let's see if there's a tiger behind this one.

[the group is huddled in the conservatory, Nell, Theo, and Markway are asleep as Luke enters and takes a drink from a liquor bottle, when the door suddenly slams shut by itself... waking everyone up!]

[to Luke]
Why aren't you upstairs?
I needed a drink.
[suddenly there are sounds of wind blowing and then distant yet distinct footsteps are heard]
Grace!
Wait a minute! It's nowhere near the nursery... it's down here,
Seems we've been on this kick before.
Next vacation I must really go somewhere else!
[the pounding becomes louder and closer]

[thinking; voice-over]
It knows my name, this time it knows my name!
I have to go out there.

[shouting]
No, No! It hasn't hurt me. Why should it hurt her?
She might try to do something about it!
[the pounding stops]
Is it over, Theo? Is it?
No, I'm still cold. It's going to start everything all over again!
[the pounding resumes violently and loudly against the closed door]

[screaming]
It can't get in! It can't get in! Don't let it get in!
[the pounding stops and the door knob jiggles]

[whimpering]
God, it knows I'm here!
[the door begins to buckle and bend in on itself, Luke in his horror drops his bottle]
Doc... I'll let you have the house cheap!
[the bulging door returns to normal, the wind is heard blowing again. Soon the pounding footsteps resume and head upstairs]

[thinking to herself; voice-over]
Go on and on and come back again until it finds me! On and on and on until it finds me!
Can't you feel it? It's alive... watching.
Ghosts make the papers along with celebrities every day of the week.
I don't think you killed your mother.

[panicking]
But where?
Home of course.
Back to your little apartment, where all your things are.
The house... it's alive!
[the group in the conservatory room hears the pounding and breaking glass and furniture from the unseen phantom]
It's in the nursery!

[stops Markway from opening the door]
You must be crazy!
I'm going out there!
Oh, no you don't! Not with that thing out there!

[intervenes]
Luke, we must find Mrs. Markway to find out if she's there!
[Luke shoves Eleanor aside and continues to try to stop Markway from leaving the room]
No! Don't be crazy!
I've got to get out of here! I've got to find out if Grace is all right.
Look, I don't know what that is out there, but I don't want to find out!
Get away from me! I've got to get out of here! I've got to find out if Grace is all right!
Everybody has a right to run away.
Didn't you see me?
No, but Eleanor did and it nearly killed her.
It DID kill her, seeing her's what made her crash the car.

[voice-over]
The story goes that the old lady died calling for help in the nursery upstairs; while the companion fooled around with a farmhand on the veranda.
